Q: Is there a way to output the resource reference of a terraform resource block? A:

It sounds like you are asking about the terraform output CLI command. In this situation you would execute:

terraform output bastion_host_resource_block_name

in a GHA step from your root module directory to output the desired reference for subsequent deletion.

Q: Why does "dtoa.c" contain so much code? A:

Large part of the dtoa implementation is lookup tables for things like powers of 10 which are used to speed up the conversion:

static BF96 pten[667] = {
    { 0xeef453d6, 0x923bd65a, 0x113faa29, -1136 },
    { 0x9558b466, 0x1b6565f8, 0x4ac7ca59, -1132 },
        ...

If you don't care about performance you can write a much smaller implementation using arbitrary-precision arithmetic. For example, implementing it from scratch in C++ or other language is ~150 lines of code and it is comparable to sprintf in speed: https://vitaut.net/posts/2024/simple-dtoa/.

David Gay's dtoa is also a bit outdated. Modern algorithms are significantly simpler, e.g. Schubfach can be implemented in ~200 lines of code plus ~600 line lookup table (which can be compressed): https://vitaut.net/posts/2025/smallest-dtoa/.

Q: QlikSense version control with Git? A:

Qlik Sense apps don’t version well at the file level like QlikView, so the usual approach is to track scripts, measures, sheets, and other logical components in Git or Bitbucket instead of the .qvf; SenseOps follows this model. You can check out https://www.senseops.com/code-management/
for how they handle it.

Q: django-select2 with field without foreignkey A:

This is possible. Here is an example, but providing more clarity on what you would like to accomplish would be helpful. The model assumes the generic Django app structure:

Here is your model

class MyModel(models.Model):
    field1 = models.CharField(max_length=100)
    field2 = models.CharField(max_length=100)

And then here is a toy form

This will show the existing fields in the form

from django import forms
from django_select2.forms import ModelSelect2Widget
from .models import MyModel

class MyForm(forms.ModelForm):
    class Meta:
        model = MyModel
        fields = ['field1', 'field2']
        widgets = {
            'field1': ModelSelect2Widget(
                model=MyModel,
                search_fields=['field1__icontains'],
                attrs={'data-tags': 'true'}
            ),
            'field2': ModelSelect2Widget(
                model=MyModel,
                search_fields=['field2__icontains'],
                attrs={'data-tags': 'true'}
            ),
        }
